definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The term "quickening" refers to the rising pulse rate during the second stage of labor.
sentences.chinese: 術語“胎動”定義爲分娩的第二產程期間加快的脈搏。

sentences.english: Fetal movement (FM) monitoring is an important precautionary measure to prevent fetal death.
sentences.chinese: 胎動監護是預防圍產期胎死的一項重要措施。

sentences.english: Quickening (maternal perception of fetal movement) occurs at about 17 weeks.
As regards the movement is that small animals like Romaine mix kind of a boy.
sentences.chinese: 至於胎動是說像小動物拌落毛樣的是男孩。

sentences.english: Is a fetus that has not yet quickened alive or not?
sentences.chinese: 尚未胎動的胎兒是活的抑或不然？

sentences.english: Indicated for quickening due to heat-stagnation.

definition: yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
impotence/also written 陽痿|阳痿[yang2 wei3]
top-heavy/fig. unbalance in organization or political structure
disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
to feel sick/to feel nauseous/to feel disgusted
